byline.contributor: Jawad Sukhanyar and Ahmad Shakib contributed reporting from Kabul, Taimoor Shah from Kandahar

abstract: Memo From Afghanistan; opposition party Council of Protection and Stability threatens Afghan Pres Ashraf Ghani’s government, saying it will lose legitimacy unless it holds local elections; new council, containing members from former Pres Hamid Karzai's cabinet, is divided over its demands, particularly one calling for immediate meeting of tribal elders to decide government’s fate.
lead_paragraph: The opposition to the government of President Ashraf Ghani, called the Council of Protection and Stability, already mirrors the struggling administration in its disunity.

headline.main: Afghan Government Faces New Set of Rivals
headline.print_headline: Kabul Government Faces New Set of Rivals

snippet: The opposition to the government of President Ashraf Ghani, called the Council of Protection and Stability, already mirrors the struggling administration in its disunity.
